jsongminer
Class EmbeddedTagMiner

java.lang.Object
  jsongminer.EmbeddedTagMiner

public class EmbeddedTagMiner
extends java.lang.Object

An object of this class is used to extract embedded metadata from an audio file. Upon instantiation, an object of this class is given a file path, which it stores, and from which it then extracts and stores embedded metadata tags. Certain individual field values can then be extracted using method calls. Note that instantiation of an object of this class fails if the embedded metadata cannot be extracted. Typically, the best way to access most or all of the embedded information extracted is to call the getAllAvailableNewMetaData method.

Metadata extraction is performed using the Jaudiotagger third-party library (http://www.jthink.net/jaudiotagger/). Metadata can be extracted only from file types supported by this library, namely MP3, MP4 (MP4, M4a and M4p), Ogg Vorbis, FLAC and WMA, as well as limited support for WAV and Real Audio.

Constructor Detail

EmbeddedTagMiner

public EmbeddedTagMiner(java.lang.String audio_file_path)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Instantiate this object and extract and store embedded metadata from the specified audio file in this object's fields.

Parameters:
audio_file_path - The path of the audio file to extract metadata from. It may be any type of audio file supported by the Jaudiotagger library (see http://www.jthink.net/jaudiotagger/)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if the specified file path is invalid, or if metadata cannot be parsed from the file.

getTitle

public java.lang.String getTitle()
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Return the title tag that was extracted upon this object's instantiation.

Returns:
The title tag. Note that this cannot be null or the empty string, as an exception is thrown if it would be.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if the title tag was not successfully extracted.

getAllAvailableNewMetaData

public boolean getAllAvailableNewMetaData(java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                          boolean store_fails)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
Stores all available song metadata that has been extracted from an audio file during the construction of this object and adds it to the given song_metadata.

Parameters:
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted an indication is added to the stored MusicMetaData highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored. Note that this parameter has no effect on song identification specifically.
Returns:
True is returned if a change was made to song_metadata, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if invalid parameters are passed.
